line-7: Key Vacancy Information:Job Title: Programme Manager (Change) Role Type: Full Time, PermanentLocation: York George Stephenson House (please note this role is also being advertised to be based at London or Derby) Closing date: 1st December 2023Salary: starting at £71,163 and increasing to £80,060 (plus Employee Healthcare)Car Allowance: £6,000 per annumAnnual Leave: 28 days + bank holidaysHours: 35 per week *Employees will be entitled to a 75% discount off leisure travel from December 2022, this includes all Advance, off peak and super off peak tickets* About Network Rail: Network Rail has played a key role in keeping the country moving during the coronavirus pandemic – and we will play an equally important part in rebuilding from it.We get people where they need to be, whether they are commuting to work, visiting friends or family, or going for a night out.We make millions of lives better every day and have a vital job in driving the economy and prosperity of the nation!https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nLZ7OYSoQVUOver the coming years we will be building and improving crucial rail links between the country’s biggest cities, making our services faster, more comfortable and more reliable for the people who rely on us.We’re also changing our organisation to put the passenger at the heart of everything we do, to make our people even prouder to work for us and to be recognised as a true leader in our industry. In joining Network Rail, you’re not only joining an organisation with a vital role to play for the country, but also a team of more than 40,000 people, and a business dedicated to being one of Britain’s best employers.
line-9: To manage the development and delivery of a programme of change projects to agreed scope, time, cost and quality requirements, working with Function Directors, Executive Sponsors and their representatives.
line-11: Key Accountabilities – 1. Agree remit and success criteria of change projects with the relevant Executive Sponsors and Functional Directors. 2. Manage the development and delivery of a programme of change projects in compliance with company processes and procedures. 3. Manage the production of project management plans for change projects. 4. Act as project sponsor when required. 5. Establish and manage collaborative cross-functional virtual teams to deliver change projects, where appropriate. 6. Deliver regular progress reports on a programme of change projects, including relevant risks and issues, to Executive Sponsors and Functional Directors. 7. Manage project budgets within agreed targets. 8. Promote and monitor the use of efficiency improvement methods. 9. Disseminate lessons learnt. 10. Business Transformation requirements in line with the current operating model 11. Establish new governance, Strategy, Structures, Processes, Rewards and People 12. Develop a Key Account management process for 3rd / outside party projects (Clients / Investors). 13. Develop a relationship with internal stakeholders including business development. 14. Lead for the business development activities with future pipeline of projects Essential · Relevant experience in the successful management of major and complex change programmes. · Experience of applying programme / project methodologies · Commercial and financial awareness. · Experience in Transformation · Experience in developing operating model. · Experience in Stakeholder management · Experience in Investment appraisals Desirable · Educated to degree level. · Member of project association · Knowledge of the principles of investment processes and procedures. · Knowledge of/experience in the UK rail industry. · Previous ASPRO Experience
